Reviews.Author: Monica Archibald "Instant Assistant, Inc."
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV in September 2012 after a tremendous deal of research and comparison shopping. We are extremely happy with it; the 3D is awesome, it has a great refresh rate and the Smart TV features are pretty cool, except kind of slow. It networks with other devices (computer, tablet, smartphone, etc.), which is a neat featureThe only thing that makes us rate it 4 stars instead of 5 is the sound. It is SO BAD that you absolutely MUST buy the sound bar if you want it to sound ok. We went with the Samsung HWE450 Crystal Surround Air Track which makes it sound good, but I've heard much better for not that much more. That will be the first thing we upgrade. Other than that, it's a great TV!To correctly set the color, I suggest you go to:http://forums.cnet.com/7723-19410_102-561058/samsung-pn60e8000-picture-settings/?messageId=5300232&tag;=rb_content;contentBody#message5300232.

Reviews.Author: French Mex
Reviews.Content: The screen came delivered cracked It took a few days to get it replaced. Other than that the new screen is clean and as good as any other samsung.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: JeepTJ12
Reviews.Content: Nice TV with great picture.  I did notice a slight buzz that everyone was talking about.  The apps can be slow at times.  The streaming is definitely slower than my xbox so we stream with xbox for hulu and netflix.  Other than that it is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV is smart choice
Reviews.Author: R. Roy
Reviews.Content: My wife was concerned about the size and learning another remote control.  She does not complain about the size and loves the remote since it does all the functions including getting Netflix.  The clarity is excellent and I cannot easily distinguish between a Blu-ray or regular DVD because the picture quality is so high.  The picture is visible from all angles and bright even in daylight.The smart features work very well with a good wireless router and we have no trouble streaming programming.  We also use a digital antenna and those signals provide excellent pictures as well.I have owned a top Samsung LED TV previously and wanted the new one to be equal to it or better.  I got what I wanted.

Reviews.Content: For the price, it is pretty good overall, but the set setup for voice and gestures commands is pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: Great plasma television

Reviews.Content: The television is great and would get five stars if not for the sometimes annoying faint buzzing sound it emits. Completely normal I hear though.

Reviews.Title: Smart T.V.

Reviews.Content: This has been the best t.v. I have owned. 3D is great. I did not know what to expect and have been very happy. Still learning to operate but the voice recognition works well. Best part is that even though it is bigger that the t.v. it replaced, the screen and not the cabinet is bigger.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable.  Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Bill Oliver "Bill Oliver"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful.  Bells, whistles, sirens are all there and easily accessible.  I think.  Perhaps one day I will find them all, but for now, one would be foolish to complain about any element of this outstanding television.  I think today's higher end TV pictures are all quite spectacular with this one surely being among them.  If there might be a niggling down side, perhaps the built in sound is weak, and perhaps the electronic feature set is simply too cute by half.  Nevertheless, an outstanding machine.

Reviews.Title: awesome picture super thin and what a deal
Reviews.Author: crystalcleanteam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful tv super thin and amazing picture. Now the few tiny details. We have cable internet with wifi. The wireless antenna in the tv is ok not great and if you really want to use the Smart part of the tv such as internet browser streaming content etc, we ran a cat 6 cable thru the attic straight to the modem.  Fyi my smartphones and tablets pick up perfectly in the same room and speed tests on those devices were at 18-20mbps and the tv had a extremely difficult time downloading anything apps etc. There was barely 1 bar. Ok now that we hard wired it its way cool lots of fun basicly a computer, almost...On blu ray its unreal how clear this picture is amazing contrast and colors. We have it on the wall in an extremely bright room and its plenty bright. Although if we want to watch a movie and be wowed we wait till evening time.The tv does have some glare that's kind of annoying under some times of the day in our bright room in certain seating positions.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Eric W.
Reviews.Content: What a picture...after making the recommended adjustments from an earlier post I was able to watch all of the NCAA basketball tournament without blur and when I switched to a Blu-Ray 3D (Avatar) I thought I was at the theater watching the movie. I debated a long time about active vs. passive 3D and in this case I feel active 3D is better. I have 2 other Televisions that are passive 3D and Active on the Samsung was better.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!!!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Been waiting for years to upgrade my entertainment environment and this is the centerpiece. I got a great price by getting late year model just before new models came out, I am sure I can live with out some of the newest features to save a thousand bucks. I wall mounted it and it looks great in my man cave with a complete sound system. The TV itself is great, bright color, simple controls and all the Smart stuff, although have not used those features much. I got a wireless keyboard for the apps, but some like NetFlix still wants you to use the cursor and single letter approach, not sure why it does not recognize that I have a keyboard, is this a Samsung TV thinkg, or the NetFlix app itself, but hopefully a software upgrade will allow me to use the keyboard for all the smart apps this TV comes with.

Reviews.Content: picture quality is great,blu rays crystal clear,voice and motion controls are glitchy,but great tv,motion controls cant be used in dark  rooms,must be well lit

Reviews.Author: M. Wildy
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this plasma TV over any LED or LCD. The picture is probably the best you will get without spending 3 or 4 times the money. I purchased a Sharp 70" top of the line before this TV. It was bad. The Sharp (not so sharp) was good at best in HD and really bad in SD. I returned it without a single question asked for Amazon. Amazon is worth it just for the peace and mind that they stand 100% behind what they sell.I would highly recommend this Samsung Plasma and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: PN51E8000, love it
Reviews.Author: Eleana Carrasquero
Reviews.Content: I love the TV, the 2D to 3D converts works terrific, I really wanted a 3D TV, for see movies with my kidm and it is great, really and amazing TV, when you play in it a Blu ray disc is amazing. The only bad thing about this, is the sound. But by now I'm buying a home theater

Reviews.Content: CAN'T GIVE IT 5 STARS SIMPLY CAUSE I HAVEN'T OWNED IT LONG ENOUGH. EVERYTHING SO FAR IS GREAT ABOUT IT.

Reviews.Author: Cristopher Carter
Reviews.Content: when this came I thought, oh my that's huge.as was told when buying a 3D tv to buy big as the glasses "shrink" the TV sizethey do.the 3D is amazing! so glad I went with active glasses instead of passivevery little tweaking was needed on the picture out of the box.only minus is that it keeps dropping the WiFi signal and the voice and motion control needs much improvement

Reviews.Title: This is a awesome Smart TV
Reviews.Author: keith
Reviews.Content: I will admit some of the bells & whistle on this unit we will not use. With that said. I have to say outstaning picture we have watched blu-ray 3D, HD-DVD, and regular definition TV on this thing and all of it looks great. the 3D is awesome i find myself trying to follow objects off the screen. If you have the right lighting skip the LED-LCD TV's this thing beats them hands down!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: John Moore
Reviews.Content: While all the extras (camera, voice control, motion control) really barely function, everything else about this television is great.  The image quality is stellar, everything loads super quick, everything from Amazon Prime to Vimeo has an app for this television, and they all look amazing and are super easy to use.  Be aware that if you have certain television providers HBO Go will not work on this TV, only the Xbox has HBO Go with comcast.  (I'm certain that it's not Samsung's fault, definitely is Comcast).Use 2 hands when you pivot the TV on the stand, it is a little bit wobbly.  I have no buzz, but I also actually put the ferrite cores on the cables in the back, from what I've read, not putting them on is what causes the loud buzzing!I would highly recommend HD cable, basic Comcast gets either slightly stretched, or slightly cut off on the sides depending on the picture setting.  If you have a Mac, and want to share it's media with this television without buying and Apple TV, try Serviio, it's free and it gets the job done.  I think most PCs can connect with the Allshare app...

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Sceptic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television recently and this is my first ever review on Amazon so this is a brief review but I will hopefully update it.Picture quality: Excellent.Features: Excellent. Especially Netflix over wireless network which works flawlessly.Quality of 3D images in the provided samples: Outstanding.Sound quality: So so even after adjustments although tolerable now than when first received when we almost returned it because of the poor sound quality.The "smart tv" features esp. the fancy remote and voice and gesture control: Gimmicky but of no practical use.Overall value: Excellent. Have had it for about 4 weeks. Similar product considered: Panasonic VT65. I have not seen the Panasonic TV so don't know if it is better but Consumer Reports rates them similarly and I am happy with the Samsung so far.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy Samsung
Reviews.Author: Zakaria "Zak"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I was a Samsung Guy I still have a DLP from them. I had just bought the TV few weeks ago. Suddenly, the first one it didn't work, Amazon was great to replace that one without any problem and no shipping charges. After few weeks the second set started going darker when I use any of Samsung application and to make maters worst a horizontal violet line show up in the middle of the TV. I called Samsung support and after many hours of troubleshooting they want it to send someone to fix it, they claim it may be a power problem. A Two week old TV $1800  , 100 hours of breaking  in , are you kidding me. Again, Shame on them, as I myself an electronics engineer and my house is surge-protected and the TV was connected to a Sony Blu-ray. This is the end of Samsung appliances in my life. Bye for good.

Reviews.Title: Samsung plasma
Reviews.Author: Paulm
Reviews.Content: Screwey tvCamera works when it wants toMotion and voice control menu pops up when ever itvwants to and stops the tv

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture
Reviews.Author: JonathanM
Reviews.Content: I have the 64 inch version and it is the perfect hub for our family media room.  Picture is just stunning compared with the LCD TV it replaced.  My son's XBox graphics with motion are simply amazing.  We love the impressive 3D performance, and just wish Amazon had 3D content available to rent since 3D blueray disks are still in the $30 range.  I get 45 channels of over the air TV and it is all amazingly clear and crisp.  A great way to watch football, basketball, or baseball in all its full 1080P glory.This TV has 3 HDMI ports and not four like our old one.  However Amazon sells an auto-sensing 3 or 5 port HDMI switch that I use to share the HDMI3 port on the TV.  As long as only one device is powered up at a time (the XBox or a computer) it auto-magically selects the correct one.  Problem solved.My home theater sound system is a gorgeous old analog system, and the TV has no analog sound output.  However Amazon sells a little converter box that does a great job of converting the digital audio from the TV to the full Dolby audio to drive the system.  So I can keep my surround sound.So if you have older generation equipment you want to integrate with this TV, just plan on spending an extra $50 or so for the little glue boxes you will need.  BTW:  If you have an old Wii to hook in, make the investment to buy a component cable for it (again Amazon sells them).  The old Wii supports 480P with the component cable, which is noticeably crisper than then A/V cable input on a TV this big.The only fly in the ointment I have found is that when using Netflix or Hulu from SmartHub, the digital sound output is disabled and one cannot use the surround sound, only the TV speakers.  I get around this by using the XBox or Blueray player to access Netflix or Hulu.  Sooner or later I think Samsung will figure out that they are losing movie rental sales through their SmartHub, and do a software update to fix it.  But until then, it sort of limits the usefulness of the SmartHub functionality.I do hear the soft buzz from the Plasma high voltage supply when the sound is off, but I really don't notice it when watching at normal volume.  Unless one is a person that used to hear the 15 KHz. scan on the old CRT TV's, I would not let buzz fear keep you from this great performing TV.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, way better then LED!!!
Reviews.Author: kyeoh1
Reviews.Content: And for $1170, you can go wrong with this.... the color are so beautiful and this screen refresh so fast compare to LED, you really need to see it to believe the quality of plasma!

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned Picture is perfect, 3D is perfect, and the high tech features will blow you away.
Reviews.Author: richard b. stewart
Reviews.Content: GREAT! Samsung is at the top of their game. I've gone all Samsung, Phone, Tablet, and Bluray Player. Right now they are the game and their 8000 series TV is as good as it gets! Also there is no so called "hum", don't know what some reviewers are talking about. I've had the TV about 45 days and have not yet found any faults.

Reviews.Title: think twice
Reviews.Author: gregparrott
Reviews.Content: I love samsung for android and the pic on these tvs are good. but thats alot of money too spend. Also the blue tooth modelure went out three times .Samsung was great about sending it to the shop, but not replacing it after repeated problems for same thing and they said they would. what good it 3000,00 plus tv to you if it doesnt work and is always in the shop. You can get these feature alot cheaper by adding them on a better tv . Wish I could write a beter review for the quality of these smart tv because I like samsung, but they didnt keep there word . buy at your own risk . If you have extra money to throw away and risk it , you can, but 3500.00 was a big investment to me for a smart tv that wasnt worth 400.00 .and three 3d , why bother , they rarely add anything new to thier 3d app.

Reviews.Title: Plasma is not DEAD! Color and Beautiful Reproduction Galore!
Reviews.Author: A. Lwin "GIStech"
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to buy a plasma. I purchased the older model a few years back and loved the HD display. Of course there is that buzz that was so apparent with the models a few years back. I returned that one because it was too loud! This one still has the buzzing noise and though it's there, it's not that bad when you weigh in that this TV display in HDTV...Period! The buzz thing is very minimal and I barely hear it. I'm not too much into all the gadgets that came with the TV as I'm only interested in the cinematic quality of the movies in HD. The movies are spectacular and you'll never see that better than on this Plasma 3D HDTV from Samsung. Forget the LED HDTV's as it is really harsh on the colors and skin tones of actors in the movies or HDTV shows. LED HDTV is like watching "Days of our Lives" and too SOAPY like picture quality. Overall this is a nice purchase for me and maybe my wife/kid will use all the technology that came with the HDTV. Me, I'm happy enjoying the movies that were meant to be...spectacular color reproduction, smooth and deep blacks and oh did I mention none of that motion blur in action scenes. I gave this 4 stars. 1 star minus because of the faint buzzing noise. I'm sure Samsung will get it right someday with the buzzing noise and PLASMA is NOT DEAD!

Reviews.Title: Amazon and Samsung rocks
Reviews.Author: HB
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is awesome and the 3D effect is very good with no ghosting but the motion controls are annoying.  Sometimes the onscreen motion control menu just pops up and stays there for a minute or so.  I think the TV is mistaking my face for my hand or something.  My arms get tired anyway holding them up trying to control the TV so I just disabled the feature.  I also disabled the voice controls.  They were cool but I couldn't be bothered trying to remember the commands.  It's just easier to pick up one of the remotes.  Speaking of remotes, I would have preferred that Samsung had incorporated all the features into one remote.  This is my first big screen TV and I've only ever seen 3D in the theaters so my opinion is not based on a ton of experience.  At any rate, dealing with Amazon was great and the delivery service (Pilot Freight I think it was) was very professional.  I would definitely buy this TV from Amazon again.

Reviews.Title: I liked
Reviews.Author: Junior
Reviews.Content: It was great but came damaged during shipping. It had warranty so it got fixed for free. I would like anybody who love 3D picture TVs to buy this. It's a small theatre style entertainment but great value.

Reviews.Title: Samsung picture quality issues...
Reviews.Author: Jacek
Reviews.Content: I have bough previous high-end model PN58C8000 via amazon.com. The picture was ok for first few months, but I started showing annoying magenta hue on white background.  Samsung did replace my panel within 1 year warranty, however after my warranty completely expired after15 months, the problem came back. Now I'm facing high repair cost. Honestly, I will not recommend buying Samsung plasma again to my friends and family, I don't care how good & slick the design is. I would expected the TV to last at least 5 years without major issues, but in this case there is definitely quality problem.CAN YOU HEAR IT SAMSUNG! FIX IT FOR FREE.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Maria Gonzalez-Mariner
Reviews.Content: TV powers itself off. Audio freezes and repeats like a skipping record. Apps constantly crash. Samsung support not helpful at all. Loved our first Samsung television so decided to buy another. Was professionally installed. Began having problems before we had it a week. Thought we had a lemon but see same issues in other reviews. I doubt I will ever buy Samsung again unless they finally help me, own up to the TV's issues and stand behind their product and take care of their customers! Our first Samsung (D7000 55" LED) that isn't 2 years old yet just went out as well.

Reviews.Title: Great hardware, terrible software
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is great - love the 60" size, very nice picture handles both sports and movies with ease.However, all the smart gestures and voice commands are garbage, they don't work. And the software is very poorly done - my TV's entire internet-enabled smart hub stopped working completely after a week and I had to go through a 40-minute software update and recalibration process with Samsung tech support.Also, despite their advertisements - this TV does NOT support the HBOGo app. I called Samsung support and confirmed - don't let them tell you otherwise.

Reviews.Title: satisfecho con la compra
Reviews.Author: Carlos Gomez
Reviews.Content: Es justamente lo que esperaba, buen producto, llego sin problemas estoy contento, me gusta y prodría recomendarlos sin ningún problema.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!!!!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Best TV ever!! Love it!!! The picture is amazing!!! Bright color dark blacks! Looks very sharp and clean. Can't believe the tv looks so great

Reviews.Author: Frustrated with Samsung
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with this model. The TV turns on and off automatically, or power cycles.Now I have to have a service tech come out on a brand new TV.

Reviews.Content: Great for movies if you can handle the buzz. Some games looked pretty bad like skyrim and red dead redemption. Voice and gesture controls did not work very well.

This reflects poorly on Amazon for their selection of shipping company. In the end Amazon gave me $30 promo code, but me taking a day off from work is not worth $30 + time to drive and pick up TV + carrying 80 pound box 3 flights of stairs.additional update: 03/31/2012response to cabby on the comments:tv is quiet amazing. black are truly very black... tv on time is super quick. amazing set. colors are super vivid and so is brightness. the smart tv features are great. there's netflix vudu youtube pandora Skype (camera is also pretty damn good quality). one negative is no support for amazon prime streaming. sad because that's the only service i have. speakers are also pretty good, but out of the world, but great for such a slim tv. love the very black bezel. no issues so far in terms of picture quality/audio quality.unfortunately, i have to return the first one i received because i found a scratch one inch long on the top right side of the bezel. the black paint is removed and it's a 1 inch white scratch. found it 2 days of 24 hr break-in period (color and gray scale slides @ 1080p). amazon was nice enough to ship me a new one which will arrive on monday or tuesday. Amazon offered me 10% off if i keep the scratched tv... i said h*ll no. they're sending it by a different shipping service, not pilot but CEVA. hopefully they will be better than pilot and i can increase the rating. lol - everyone is complaining about the rating but i don't care. i consider my overall shopping experience when i review.going back to the tv. i have tried the 3D feature many times and loveee it. the glasses are very comfortable. i don't notice any crosstalk. the video is a lot dimmer through the 3D glasses, but what can u do. the tech isn't there yet.another great feature is that the tv supports VERY VERY GOOD VIDEO STREAMING out of the box. my home is on N-5Ghz network and blu-ray 720p & 1080p streaming out of the box has been very good. streamed 1080p wall-e (mkv), 720p batman beyond (mkv), 1080p the matrix (mkv). ALL flawless. My set up is ReadyNAS Duo v2 with 1 TB RAID-X, Netgear WNDR3700v2, gigabit switch. All on Cat5e ethernet with gigabit switch. Streaming is excellent.The only thing that's connected to it right now is my Xbox 360 and been playing a lot of halo reach. really good. no lag. 600 refresh rate is really great. just worried a little about the HUD giving image retention, but oh well... i love my games. just purchased ps3 for more blu-ray/3D action, but didn't take it out of the box yet to set up. also grabbed a copy of disney's WOW blu-ray calibration disk. might use that along with my Spyder4Pro calibrator after break in period of 150 hrs is over.i was seriously debating over panasonic 2012 VT50 models, but couldn't wait for a new tv until may/june (their estimated release date) because i just moved into a new apartment and needed a tv real bad.anyway the tv is a beauty. love the X stand unlike the huge big flat tv stand with the pannys.ask me any other questions.additional update: 04/01/2012- you never know if the built-in camera is on. bad decision on samsung's part. they should have some sort of indicator that the camera is on (i.e., macbook pro FaceTime cameras with the green light on the side)... i can see some sort of privacy issues coming up with that. also the camera is very poor in low light as expected for a small camera+ voice commands on the touch remote work very well... some what usefuladditional update: 04/02/2012RECEIVED MY FIRST REPLACEMENT:major issue: VERTICAL BANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DISPLAY.you can clearly see a vertical banding issue when there's a gray/white photo on the display. I thought I was crazy, but I brought a friend over to confirm. She also sees a vertical band in the middle of the screen. Contacted Amazon for a 2nd replacement. So sad. This TV is taking up way too much of my time.additional update: 04/30/2012RECEIVED MY 2ND REPLACEMENTno more vertical banding. this is a great tv. updated to the latest firmware. there was a cosmetic issue with the tv which was a small dent on the clear plastic bezel of the tv, but you can only tell if you get up close.another small issue is image retention. it's very apparent if you watch channels like TNT with their bright white logo on the bottom left or right... the TNT logo is still there even when you turn the tv on and off but goes away after a while. annoying but it's the same with most plasmas.i used CNET's calibration numbers:[...]

Reviews.Title: Do not buy samsung's so called "smart" products
Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: IF SAMSUNG'S INTERNAL SERVERS GO DOWN YOUR SO CALLED "SMART" TV CAN NOT ACCESS ONLINE CONTENT. Recently samsung's servers went down and I could not access amazon, vudu, netflix or any other source of online content. I have sony, vizio, and panasonic internet connected products and I have never experienced anything like the slow, buggy, and intermittent at best, experience as with this samsung tv.Even when it is working their interface is awful. They have their choice of preloaded apps smack in the middle of the screen and you can't delete them. During one of their recent server outages ( read: can't access any online content) and patiently going through their required trouble shooting steps, it took me two hours to get their "service" techs to admit the problem was on their end. Their answer "try back in 24-48 hours" "we're aware of the problem and are working on it"Update:I posted a similar review on the samsung website and not surprisingly they rejected my post. "Your review does not conform to our posting guidelines"!On person replied critical of my post as a rant and I should not trash the entire TV because of slow samsung servers. If you are in the market for a "regular TV" you would be crazy to pay the extra money for a smart TV like this one. It is a plasma, the picture quality is OK, the sound, like any flat screen is poor. On that subject I bought a Samsung sound bar to go with the tv and you can't control it with the TV remote. It will not turn on AND off with the TV. Another example of poor engineering. While it is true that other brands need to connect to external servers for some functionality the others that I have don't become completely disabled when they can't connect.If you are in the market for a network enabled smart TV look elsewhere. If your priority is good picture quality, sound etc save your money and skip the bells and whistles or get a high end TV and a network enabled, smart blu-ray player.

Reviews.Title: Display needs replacing after less than 3 years of light use
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: My high end Samsung 52" 3D TV has developed a horizontal black line across the entire upper portion of the screen.  The TV was made May 2010.  Samsung reports they need $1000 to repair this problem since the display must be replaced.  A web search indicates this problem is not rare.  Beware of Samsung TVs.  If you must buy a Samsung then also consider buying a very very very long term extended warranty that covers repairs such as mine.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY A PLASMA TV!!
Reviews.Author: VizFX_Guy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Samsung PN59D7000 59" Plasma 3D HDTV after exhaustive research. The TV was actually hailed as the TV of the year in some circles. I've been in the TV/Film industry for 20 years and knew enough to avoid plasma TV's due to a myriad of issues. However, after reading all of the reviews, and going to the store to check out the picture quality, I was frankly very impressed. The reviews seemed to say that burn-in was no longer an issue and that the black levels and picture quality were unsurpassed. The 3D aspect of the TV was a bonus.Cutting to the heart of the reason for this review, I'll just say that I have SEVERE burn-in after only one month of use. Turns out that the stations that I watch have "bugs" and ID "banners" up for every show and they are now ghosted into my screen. I called Samsung for some support, and guess what? Burn-in is NOT covered under their warranty. Even if it happens that quickly. I was at a loss. I explained to them that this was not acceptable, but they held fast. I told them that by omitting burn-in from their warranty, they were in fact ADMITTING that it was a problem that they expected to happen. Otherwise, they would stand behind their product. They then suggested that to avoid burn-in, I should watch different channels throughout the day. Seriously, this was their solution. My solution after spending $1800 on a TV that is now defective is to first NEVER buy another plasma TV, and second, NEVER buy another Samsung product as they refuse to stand behind their products.
